clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Intraoperative Esmolol on Post-mastectomy Pain Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Intraoperative Esmolol on Post-mastectomy Pain Syndrome: a Cross-sectional Study

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic postoperative pain is an entity that is usually neglected by anesthetists, but several studies show that the choice of anesthetic technique may interfere with this prevalence. Esmolol is a selective beta-blocker of ultra fast duration that has been studied as a perioperative venous adjuvant with antihyperalgesic and opioid sparing action. The investigators ventured the possibility of this anti-hyperalgesic effect attenuating the chronic pain syndrome post-mastectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of post-mastectomy chronic pain syndrome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 to 9 month
primary_outcome.description: Incidence analysis using a questionnaire applied to patients in the late postoperative period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the intensity of pain: Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 to 9 month
secondary_outcome.description: Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale, from zero to 10: 0 being represented by absence of pain and 10 being the worst possible pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 to 9 month
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence analysis using a questionnaire applied to patients in the late postoperative period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stratify the possible types of pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 to 9 month
secondary_outcome.description: Application of a questionnaire to identify the characteristics of pain (Neuropatic or non-neuropatic pain)

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent mastectomy under standard general anesthesia Patients in placebo group received general balanced inhaled anesthesia with sevoflurane and remifentanil and a saline 0,9% infusion pump.
Patients in esmolol group received general balanced inhaled anesthesia with sevoflurane and a bolus infection of esmolol 500 mgc/kg followed by a continuous infusion of esmolol 100 mcg/kg/min

intervention.description: Patients who underwent mastectomy under standard general anesthesia
Patients who underwent mastectomy under general anesthesia with esmolol infusion
